meanings.definition: To roar louder than something else.
meanings.sent1: The lion was outroaring all the other animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The thunderstorm was outroaring the sound of the rain.
meanings.sent3: The little kitten thought it could outroar the big lion, which made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His laughter outroared the noise of the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The volcano's eruption was so powerful that it outroared any other natural disaster in history.

meanings.definition: The act of roaring louder than something else.
meanings.sent1: The outroaring of the lion could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The outroaring of the waterfall drowned out all other sounds.
meanings.sent3: The outroaring of the tiny squirrel trying to scare off the bear was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The outroaring of the crowd at the concert was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The outroaring of the engine signaled the start of the race.
